PingER comes pre-configured, but it is possible to add and delete from this basic list of hosts.

== PingER Config Step 1 ==

Like most of the GUIs it is necessary to log in with the _*knoppix*_ user or some other configured username.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_1.png

== PingER Config Step 2 ==

The GUI looks like this by default, populated with several services.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_2.png

== PingER Config Step 3 ==

To add a host to an existing domain, mouse over the domain to find an additional menu/

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_3.png

== PingER Config Step 4 ==

Enter in the _*node name*_, e.g. the hostname without the domain.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_4.png

== PingER Config Step 5 ==

Another menu will appear with specific information about test to perform.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_5.png

If the system could not look up the _address_ of the host it will appear as _*255.255.255.255*_.  If this is the case, be sure to enter the proper address.  

== PingER Config Step 6 ==

If you would like to add a node to a domain that is not present, add the domain first.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_6.png

Follow steps [NPToolkitPingER#Pinger_Config_Step_3 3], [NPToolkitPingER#Pinger_Config_Step_4 4], and [NPToolkitPingER#Pinger_Config_Step_5 5] to add a node to the new domain.

== PingER Config Step 7 ==

When you have added new hosts, use the _*Save MP Landmarks XML*_ button to save all changes.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_7.png

== PingER Config Step 8 ==

To select _*dynamic*_ nodes from the perfSONAR infrastructure (e.g. other instances of the NPToolkit or other participating perfSONAR sites), navigate to the bottom of the page to see existing nodes.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_8.png

== PingER Config Step 9 ==

After mousing over the instance, the ability to add it to the existing list will become available.  

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_9.png

== PingER Config Step 10 ==

After adding, a small menu will appear with options for this host, adjust any as necessary.

http://perfsonar-ps.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/NPToolkit/PingER_10.png

Be sure to save the configuration as in step [NPToolkitPingER#Pinger_Config_Step_7 7].

== PingER Config Step 11 ==

Finally from either the NPToolkit or some other machine, visit a perfSONAR testing instance described in [NPToolkitQuickStart#Service_Test Disk Verification - Service Test].
